lustre/tests/ll_dirstripe_verify.c

00033  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00034  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00035  *
00036  * lustre/tests/ll_dirstripe_verify.c
00037  *
00038  * ll_dirstripe_verify <dir> <file>:
00039  * - to verify if the file has the same lov_user_md setting as the parent dir.
00040  * - if dir's offset is set -1, ll_dirstripe_verify <dir> <file1> <file2>
00041  *      is used to further verify if file1 and file2's obdidx is continuous.
00042  */
00043 
00044 #include <stdio.h>
00045 #include <stdlib.h>
00046 #include <string.h>
00047 #include <ctype.h>
00048 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00049 #include <unistd.h>
00050 #include <fcntl.h>
00051 #include <errno.h>
00052 #include <dirent.h>
00053 
00054 #include <libcfs/util/param.h>
00055 #include <lustre/lustreapi.h>
00056 
00057 #define MAX_LOV_UUID_COUNT      1000
00058 
00059 /* Returns bytes read on success and a negative value on failure.
00060  * If zero bytes are read it will be treated as failure as such
00061  * zero cannot be returned from this function.
00062  */
00063 int read_proc_entry(char *proc_path, char *buf, int len)
00064 {
00065         int rc, fd;
00066 
00067         memset(buf, 0, len);
00068 
00069         fd = open(proc_path, O_RDONLY);
00070         if (fd < 0) {
00071                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, -errno, "cannot open '%s'",
00072                             proc_path);
00073                 return -2;
00074         }
00075 
00076         rc = read(fd, buf, len - 1);
00077         if (rc < 0) {
00078                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, -errno,
00079                             "error reading from '%s'", proc_path);
00080                 rc = -3;
00081         } else if (rc == 0) {
00082                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR,
00083                                   "read zero bytes from '%s'", proc_path);
00084                 rc = -4;
00085         } else if (buf[rc - 1] == '\n') {
00086                 buf[rc - 1] = '\0'; /* Remove trailing newline */
00087         }
00088 
00089         close(fd);
00090 
00091         return rc;
00092 }
00093 
00094 int compare(struct obd_uuid *puuid, struct lov_user_md *lum_dir,
00095             struct lov_user_md *lum_file1, struct lov_user_md *lum_file2)
00096 {
00097         int stripe_count = 0, min_stripe_count = 0, def_stripe_count = 1;
00098         int stripe_size = 0;
00099         int stripe_offset = -1;
00100         int ost_count;
00101         char buf[128];
00102         glob_t path;
00103         int i;
00104 
00105         if (cfs_get_param_paths(&path, "lov/%s/stripecount", puuid->uuid) != 0)
00106                 return 2;
00107         if (read_proc_entry(path.gl_pathv[0], buf, sizeof(buf)) < 0) {
00108                 cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00109                 return 5;
00110         }
00111         cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00112         def_stripe_count = (short)atoi(buf);
00113 
00114         if (cfs_get_param_paths(&path, "lov/%s/numobd", puuid->uuid) != 0)
00115                 return 2;
00116         if (read_proc_entry(path.gl_pathv[0], buf, sizeof(buf)) < 0) {
00117                 cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00118                 return 6;
00119         }
00120         cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00121         ost_count = atoi(buf);
00122 
00123         if (lum_dir == NULL) {
00124                 stripe_count = def_stripe_count;
00125                 min_stripe_count = -1;
00126         } else {
00127                 stripe_count = (signed short)lum_dir->lmm_stripe_count;
00128                 printf("dir stripe %d, ", stripe_count);
00129                 min_stripe_count = 1;
00130         }
00131 
00132         printf("default stripe %d, ost count %d\n",
00133                def_stripe_count, ost_count);
00134 
00135         if (stripe_count == 0) {
00136                 min_stripe_count = -1;
00137                 stripe_count = 1;
00138         }
00139 
00140         stripe_count = (stripe_count > 0 && stripe_count <= ost_count) ?
00141                                                 stripe_count : ost_count;
00142         min_stripe_count = min_stripe_count > 0 ? stripe_count :
00143                                                 ((stripe_count + 1) / 2);
00144 
00145         if (lum_file1->lmm_stripe_count != stripe_count ||
00146             lum_file1->lmm_stripe_count < min_stripe_count) {
00147                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR,
00148                                   "file1 stripe count %d != dir %d\n",
00149                                   lum_file1->lmm_stripe_count, stripe_count);
00150                 return 7;
00151         }
00152 
00153         if (lum_file1->lmm_stripe_count < stripe_count)
00154                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_WARN,
00155                                   "warning: file1 used fewer stripes"
00156                                   " %d < dir %d (likely due to bug 4900)\n",
00157                                   lum_file1->lmm_stripe_count, stripe_count);
00158 
00159         if (lum_dir != NULL)
00160                 stripe_size = (int)lum_dir->lmm_stripe_size;
00161         if (stripe_size == 0) {
00162                 if (cfs_get_param_paths(&path, "lov/%s/stripesize",
00163                                         puuid->uuid) != 0)
00164                         return 2;
00165                 if (read_proc_entry(path.gl_pathv[0], buf, sizeof(buf)) < 0) {
00166                         cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00167                         return 5;
00168                 }
00169                 cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00170 
00171                 stripe_size = atoi(buf);
00172         }
00173 
00174         if (lum_file1->lmm_stripe_size != stripe_size) {
00175                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR,
00176                                   "file1 stripe size %d != dir %d\n",
00177                                   lum_file1->lmm_stripe_size, stripe_size);
00178                 return 8;
00179         }
00180 
00181         if (lum_dir != NULL)
00182                 stripe_offset = (short int)lum_dir->lmm_stripe_offset;
00183         if (stripe_offset != -1) {
00184                 for (i = 0; i < stripe_count; i++)
00185                         if (lum_file1->lmm_objects[i].l_ost_idx !=
00186                             (stripe_offset + i) % ost_count) {
00187                                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_WARN,
00188                                           "warning: file1 non-sequential "
00189                                           "stripe[%d] %d != %d\n", i,
00190                                           lum_file1->lmm_objects[i].l_ost_idx,
00191                                           (stripe_offset + i) % ost_count);
00192                         }
00193         } else if (lum_file2 != NULL) {
00194                 int next, idx, stripe = stripe_count - 1;
00195                 next = (lum_file1->lmm_objects[stripe].l_ost_idx + 1) %
00196                        ost_count;
00197                 idx = lum_file2->lmm_objects[0].l_ost_idx;
00198                 if (idx != next) {
00199                         llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_WARN,
00200                                   "warning: non-sequential "
00201                                   "file1 stripe[%d] %d != file2 stripe[0] %d\n",
00202                                   stripe, lum_file1->lmm_objects[stripe].l_ost_idx,
00203                                   idx);
00204                 }
00205         }
00206 
00207         return 0;
00208 }
00209 
00210 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00211 {
00212         struct lov_user_md *lum_dir, *lum_file1 = NULL, *lum_file2 = NULL;
00213         struct obd_uuid uuid;
00214         int lum_size, rc;
00215         DIR *dir;
00216 
00217         if (argc < 3) {
00218                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR,
00219                                   "Usage: %s <dirname> <filename1> [filename2]\n",
00220                                   argv[0]);
00221                 return 1;
00222         }
00223 
00224         dir = opendir(argv[1]);
00225         if (dir == NULL) {
00226                 rc = -errno;
00227                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00228                             "error: %s opendir failed", argv[1]);
00229                 return rc;
00230         }
00231 
00232         lum_size = lov_user_md_size(MAX_LOV_UUID_COUNT, LOV_USER_MAGIC);
00233         lum_dir = (struct lov_user_md *)malloc(lum_size);
00234         if (lum_dir == NULL) {
00235                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00236                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00237                             "error: can't allocate %d bytes "
00238                             "for dir EA", lum_size);
00239                 goto cleanup;
00240         }
00241 
00242         rc = llapi_file_get_stripe(argv[1], lum_dir);
00243         if (rc) {
00244                 if (rc == -ENODATA) {
00245                         free(lum_dir);
00246                         lum_dir = NULL;
00247                 } else {
00248                         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00249                                     "error: can't get EA for %s", argv[1]);
00250                         goto cleanup;
00251                 }
00252         }
00253 
00254         /* XXX should be llapi_lov_getname() */
00255         rc = llapi_file_get_lov_uuid(argv[1], &uuid);
00256         if (rc) {
00257                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00258                             "error: can't get lov name for %s",
00259                             argv[1]);
00260                 return rc;
00261         }
00262 
00263         lum_file1 = malloc(lum_size);
00264         if (lum_file1 == NULL) {
00265                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00266                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00267                             "error: can't allocate %d bytes for EA",
00268                             lum_size);
00269                 goto cleanup;
00270         }
00271 
00272         rc = llapi_file_get_stripe(argv[2], lum_file1);
00273         if (rc) {
00274                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00275                             "error: unable to get EA for %s", argv[2]);
00276                 goto cleanup;
00277         }
00278 
00279         if (argc == 4) {
00280                 lum_file2 = (struct lov_user_md *)malloc(lum_size);
00281                 if (lum_file2 == NULL) {
00282                         rc = -ENOMEM;
00283                         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00284                                     "error: can't allocate %d "
00285                                     "bytes for file2 EA", lum_size);
00286                         goto cleanup;
00287                 }
00288 
00289                 rc = llapi_file_get_stripe(argv[3], lum_file2);
00290                 if (rc) {
00291                         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00292                                     "error: can't get EA for %s", argv[3]);
00293                         goto cleanup;
00294                 }
00295         }
00296 
00297         rc = compare(&uuid, lum_dir, lum_file1, lum_file2);
00298 
00299 cleanup:
00300         closedir(dir);
00301         if (lum_dir != NULL)
00302                 free(lum_dir);
00303         if (lum_file1 != NULL)
00304                 free(lum_file1);
00305         if (lum_file2 != NULL)
00306                 free(lum_file2);
00307 
00308         return rc;
00309 }
